intro: Pimpinella nigra subsp. procera, commonly known as the tall hogweed, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, often with a reddish or purplish hue. The plant features large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed and may have a hairy texture. Its flowers are small and white, clustered in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
